definition: to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to try hard to catch up

sentences.english: He got up early this morning, so that he caught the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上他起的很早，因此赶上了头班车。

sentences.english: Linda didn't catch the train. She could have caught it.
sentences.chinese: 林达没能赶上火车，她本来是可以赶上的。

sentences.english: Linda didn't catch the train. She could have caught it.
sentences.chinese: 林达没能赶上火车，她本来是可以赶上的。

sentences.english: Supposedly, we missed that very moment of Spring.
sentences.chinese: 可能，没有赶上春宵那一刻吧。

sentences.english: The devil caught him, cut open his chest and ate his heart.
sentences.chinese: 厉鬼赶上，拉住王生，挖出了他的心。

sentences.english: In order to prepare for the rush from the hall after the notice, has been late.
sentences.chinese: 张伯为准备从后厅赶上去通知，己经晚了。

sentences.english: Although the gendarmerie is ahead of the market the market is catching up.
sentences.chinese: 虽然宪兵，是市场上的领先地位，市场正在迎头赶上。

sentences.english: Yesterday morning Yang Cheng got up early, so that she caught the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 昨天早上杨成起床很早，因此，她赶上了早班车。

sentences.english: If you had got up earlier, you would have caught the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 如果你起得早一点，就赶上头班车了。

sentences.english: Drive faster and try to catch up with that bus.
sentences.chinese: 开快一点，想办法赶上公车。

sentences.english: If I had left sooner, I'd have caught the bus.
sentences.chinese: 早点动身，我就赶上巴士了。

sentences.english: They had cleared the town, as the church-bell struck two.
sentences.chinese: 他们出城的时候，正赶上教堂的钟敲两点。

sentences.english: If you had got up earlier, you could have caught the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 如果你起得早一点，就赶上头班车了。

sentences.english: But now, the Europeans have come up in quality.
sentences.chinese: 但现在，欧洲人的葡萄酒质量赶上来了。

sentences.english: I hope I can make it.

definition: can't keep up with/can't catch up with/cannot overtake
just (in time)/just right/just enough/to happen to/to chance to/by chance/it just so happens that
as it turns out/by lucky coincidence/(of number, time, size etc) just right
just/exactly/to happen to be
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
to run into/to come upon/to meet
fortunately/unexpectedly/by coincidence
to catch up with/to keep pace with
to just happen to coincide with
just at the time of/honest/upright/(math.) positive value
now/at present/subocular (medicine)
there is still time (to do sth)/to be able to do sth in time/to be able to make it
luckily/fortunately
to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
not enough time (to do sth)/too late (to do sth)
to arrive/arrival/advent
